Class ConcreteTSPHeuristic

  • java.lang.Object
    • ConcreteTSPHeuristic
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TSPHeuristic

    public class ConcreteTSPHeuristic
extends java.lang.Object
implements TSPHeuristic
    An example of a TSP heuristic used in A* search.

    • Field Detail

      • INFINITY

        private final int INFINITY
        Something large, used for initialising aggregate-minimum values. Should be bigger than any possible distance for a legal ordering of jobs.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • computeEstimate

        public int computeEstimate(Point point,
                  CompletedJobSet completedSet,
                  java.util.List<Job> jobs)
        Computes estimate of distance to the goal. Is guaranteed to be admissible.
        Specified by:
        computeEstimate in interface TSPHeuristic
        Parameters:
        point - Our current position.
        completedSet - Data structure containing information on which jobs we have completed.
        jobs - List of all jobs. Includes both completed and incomplete jobs.
        Returns:
        Estimate to the goal state.

      • getRemainingJobs

        private java.util.List<Job> getRemainingJobs(CompletedJobSet completedSet,
                                   java.util.List<Job> jobs)
        Computes remaining jobs from the given set of remaining jobs.
        Parameters:
        completedSet - Set of completed jobs.
        jobs - All jobs that must be done, including completed jobs.
        Returns:
        List of jobs that are yet to be done.
